column4: if i installed ubuntu/hardy with my hd/bios set to IDE mode, will ubuntu still boot if i switch that to AHCI? (i know you can't switch for windows)
with some tweaking, yes (grub, fstab etc.)
what kind of tweaking? i use UUIDs in both of those files -- would that prevent the need to tweak?
You might get away with GRUB, if it's the only drive in the system - I've never experimented with UUID's much, so YMMV
keep a Live CD handy in case you need to poke around, though :)
ï»¿i guess my question was more....are the only changes that might be necessary are drive paths /dev/Xda ..or some other settings?
they're the only settings I think'll matter - everything else should be fine
weren't you asking about switching to AHCI before? :)
i didn't switch :P i was in a liveCD reinstall grub when i asked about that...in a livecd cause my system was already having this grub error i thought the grub install would fix
ah - just check you're pointing GRUB at the right drive, and to where /boot/grub/menu.lst is
it isn't as simple as just installing GRUB
that looks fine, scroll up to see what legend said about post GRUB installation configuration, though
following those instructions, shows me grub is already set correctly (0,3)
and when you reboot, it still fails?
that sounds broken - it looks like you've done everything right so far, so I'm stumped
hmm, just cross-reference it with fdisk -l, and remember grub's 0-indexed, (sda1,1 -> (hd0,0) etc.)
GRUB can be idiosyncratic - tried (hd1,3) etc.?
